TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit FederationConfiguration extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Exposes properties that contain federation settings that control the behavior of the WS-Federation Authentication Module () and the Session Authentication Module () in web applications.

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default web applications have a single FederationConfiguration object that is accessed through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication.FederationConfiguration?displayProperty=fullName> property. The first time the property is accessed a new FederationConfiguration instance is initialized from settings in the configuration file and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication.FederationConfigurationCreated?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised. You can use the properties and methods exposed by the FederationConfiguration class to modify or replace the object initialized from configuration in an event handler. This object is available through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfigurationCreatedEventArgs.FederationConfiguration%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property inside the event handler.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by loading settings from the section of the configuration file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The properties in the new instance are initialized by loading settings from the `<system.identityModel.services>` configuration section. This constructor calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.%23ctor%28System.Boolean%29?displayProperty=fullName> constructor with the `loadConfig` parameter `true`.
> [!WARNING] > Before the new <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> instance is used by any of the configured HTTP modules, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.Initialize%2A> method to ensure that the instance is properly initialized.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool loadConfig) cil managed

Docs.param: to initialize with settings loaded from the configuration file; to initialize to default values.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by optionally loading settings from the section of the configuration file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!WARNING] > Before the new <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> instance is used by any of the configured HTTP modules, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.Initialize%2A> method to ensure that the instance is properly initialized.
The `system.identityModel` section must be specified in a `<section>` element under the `<configSections>` element in the configuration file or an exception is thrown.
``` <configSections> <section name="system.identityModel" type="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SystemIdentityModelSection, System.IdentityModel, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=B77A5C561934E089" /> </configSections> ```
If `loadConfig` is `true` and only a single `<federationConfiguration>` element is specified, settings are loaded using that element. If multiple `<federationConfiguration>` elements are specified, the method attempts to load settings from the element that is unnamed of that has the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.DefaultFederationConfigurationName>. If such an element does not exist, the method returns without loading settings. This results in an exception when the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.Initialize%2A> method is called.
> [!WARNING] > Microsoft recommends that if you specify multiple `<federationConfiguration>` elements in the `system.identityModel.services` configuration section that at least one of them is unnamed or has its name set to an empty string.

Docs.exception: The configuration section is not defined in the configuration file.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string federationConfigurationName) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the element from which to load the configuration.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the [\<federationConfiguration\>](../Topic/%3CfederationConfiguration%3E.md) element with the specified name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!WARNING] > Before the new <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> instance is used by any of the configured HTTP modules, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.Initialize%2A> method to ensure that the instance is properly initialized.
If this constructor is called then a `<system.identityModel.services>` configuration section with a `<federationConfiguration>` element that has the specified name must exist in the configuration file.
Both the `system.identityModel` section and the `system.identityModel.services` must be specified in a `<section>` elements under the `<configSections>` element in the configuration file or an exception is thrown.
``` <configSections> <section name="system.identityModel" type="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SystemIdentityModelSection, System.IdentityModel, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=B77A5C561934E089" /> <section name="system.identityModel.services" type="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.SystemIdentityModelServicesSection, System.IdentityModel.Services, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=B77A5C561934E089" /> </configSections> ```

Docs.exception:
There is no section defined in the configuration file.
-or-
There is no section defined in the configuration file.
-or-
There is no element with the specified name in the section.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the cookie handler to be used by the Session Authentication Module ().
Docs.value: The cookie handler to be used by the Session Authentication Module (SAM).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Specifies the cookie handler that is used to read and write session cookies by the SAM.
When initialized from a configuration file, this property is set by the [\<cookieHandler\>](../Topic/%3CcookieHandler%3E.md) element.

Docs.exception: An attempt to set the property to occurs.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the custom XML element, if any, present in this configuration.

Defines the name of the default [\<federationConfiguration\>](../Topic/%3CfederationConfiguration%3E.md) element from which settings should be loaded. This is an empty string as the default element is unnamed.
Gets or sets the object associated with this instance.
Docs.value: The identity configuration object associated with this instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When initialized from a configuration file, this property is set by the [\<identityConfiguration\>](../Topic/%3CidentityConfiguration%3E.md) element.

Docs.exception: An attempt to set the property to occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Initialize() cil managed

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method ensures that the current instance is properly initialized before it is used by the HTTP Modules to process incoming requests. It should only be called once. Check the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.IsInitialized%2A> property before calling the method. This method sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.IsInitialized%2A> property is set `true`.
The default implementation creates a default cookie handler if there is not one already configured through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.CookieHandler%2A> property and calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityConfiguration.Initialize%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method on the identity configuration object that is configured through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.IdentityConfiguration%2A> property. You can override this method to modify this behavior or to provide additional initialization in derived classes.
This method should be invoked before the class is used by the HTTP Modules to process incoming requests.

Docs.exception: The current instance has already been initialized (The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.IsInitialized%2A> property is .)

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsInitialized { get; protected set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.Initialize%2A> method has been called.
Docs.value: if the configuration object has been configured; otherwise .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to check whether the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> object has already been initialized. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration.Initialize%2A> method should be called once and only once.
The `set` operation is `protected`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void LoadConfiguration(class System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfigurationElement element) cil managed

Docs.param: The element to load settings from. Can be to load default values.
Docs.summary: Loads the properties for the current instance from the configuration file. This method is called by constructors that initialize the newly created from configuration settings.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The LoadConfiguration method is called by the constructors to set the properties of the newly created <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> object from the specified `<federationConfiguration>` element.
If `element` is `null`, the instance is loaded with default values.
If the there is no configuration file, or, if the named section does not exist, then no exception is thrown, instead the instance is loaded with default values.

Docs.summary: Gets the name associated with this instance.
Docs.value: The name associated with this federation configuration instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Corresponds to the `name` attribute of a [\<federationConfiguration\>](../Topic/%3CfederationConfiguration%3E.md) element.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the X.509 certificate used to sign WS-Federation protocol messages.
Docs.value: The X.509 certificate used to sign WS-Federation protocol messages.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When initialized from a configuration file, this property is set by the [\<serviceCertificate\>](../Topic/%3CserviceCertificate%3E.md) element.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the configuration settings for the WS-Federation Authentication Module ().
Docs.value: The configuration settings for the WS-Federation Authentication Module.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When initialized from a configuration file, this property is set by the [\<wsFederation\>](../Topic/%3CwsFederation%3E.md) element.

Docs.exception: An attempt to set the property to occurs.
